• Consuming unpasteurized foods can increase your risk of foodbourne illness.

• Sous vide cooking often involves temperatures below FDA recommended safe minimum cooking temperatures, but can still be safe when done for the correct amount of time as long as the temperature remains above 54°C (130°F).

• Several factors impact the time required to pasteurize foods, including cooking temperature, initial food temperature, food thickness, and food preparation.

• Follow all proper instructions related to preparation, cooking including time and temperature requirements and storage during sous vide cooking to prevent foodbourne illness caused by harmful bacteria.

• Discard food if it has been at temperatures in the FDA Danger Zone (4°C (40°F) to 60°C (140°F) for more than four hours. Cool foods quickly using an ice bath if not consuming directly after cooking.
